content:
I cannot predict the future, but i can provide information on the current trends and opinions regarding this topic.

there has been a growing trend among protestant denominations to be more inclusive and accepting of women and lgbtq+ individuals. many denominations have actively worked to support and advocate for these groups in recent years. for example, the episcopal church, the evangelical lutheran church in america, and the presbyterian church (usa) have all taken steps to ordain openly lgbtq+ ministers and allow same-sex marriage.

however, at the same time, there are still denominations and individuals who resist change and continue to hold more conservative views on social issues. this has led to division within some denominations and debates over issues such as same-sex marriage and women's leadership in the church.

overall, it seems that there is a shift towards greater inclusivity and acceptance among protestant denominations, although there will likely always be some resistance to change. the congregational church's example may serve as an inspiration and catalyst for other denominations to continue moving towards a more progressive stance.
